summary: Email chain between attorney Sigrid McCawley and a U.S. Attorney's Office representative regarding coordination for FBI agents to use a law firm conference room and requesting contact information for potential witnesses in the Epstein/Maxwell case. The emails discuss attempts to locate individuals who may have information about Epstein and others.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney who is coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to provide a conference room for FBI agents and attempting to provide contact information for potential witnesses.

persons.name: Dore Louis
persons.context: Previously represented a potential witness (referred to as 'her') pro bono for a deposition in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: McCawley references Dore Louis as the previous lawyer for a potential witness she is trying to contact.

events.title: FBI meeting at law firm office
events.description: FBI agents are scheduled to use a conference room at the Boies Schiller Flexner LLP office for meetings related to an investigation.

locations: Boies Schiller Flexner LLP office (location implied but not specified)
keyFacts: Attorney Sigrid McCawley is assisting the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI by providing her firm's conference room for investigative meetings.
McCawley is attempting to provide contact information for individuals who may have 'very helpful information... about Epstein and others'.
One potential witness was previously represented pro bono by lawyer Dore Louis for a deposition in the Maxwell case.
The communication highlights efforts to gather witness testimony and coordinate between law enforcement and private attorneys in the Epstein investigation.
The emails contain redactions for the names of the FBI agents, the AUSA, and the potential witnesses, indicating sensitive ongoing investigative work.
